title-part.text: MATERIALS FOR MISCELLANEOUS APPLICATIONS, NOT PROVIDED FOR ELSEWHERE

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers also the use of specified materials in general or their use for the applications not specially provided for elsewhere.
In this subclass, the following term is used with the meaning indicated: "materials" includes compositions.

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
C09K11/78-C09K11/86 covered by C09K11/77 - C09K11/7798, C09K11/87, C09K11/88, C09K11/89
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

When classifying in groups C09K3/10 - C09K3/1028 the properties and uses of the material can be further indexed by using indexing codes chosen from C09K2003/1034 - C09K2003/1096 and the chemical nature of the materials can be further indexed by using indexing codes chosen from C09K2200/00 - C09K2200/0697

CPC-specific-text.text: Materials in mouldable or extrudable form

title-part.text: for sealing or packing joints or covers

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the chemical nature of one of its constituents
Macromolecular compounds having one or more carbon-to-silicon linkages
characterised by non-chemical features of one or more of its constituents
Sealing waxes, e.g. sealing letters, bottles, or the like
Materials or components characterised by specific properties
Materials or components characterised by specific uses

title-part.text: Materials for stopping leaks, e.g. in radiators, in tanks

reference.text: products specifically intended for the fabrication of abrasive tools, blocks or papers, or for operations of the kind of sand-blasting and barrelling B24B31/14, B24C1/00; polishing compositions containing abrasive or grinding agents C09G1/02; polishing of semi-conductors H01L; friction compositions for brakes or clutches F16D69/02

note.note-paragraph: In this group, boron and silicon are considered as being metals. Likewise for associations of carbon with metals, e.g. carbides.

CPC-specific-text.text: obtained by division of a mass agglomerated by sintering
obtained by division of a mass agglomerated by melting, at least partially, e.g. with a binder
the coating consisting exclusively of metals
Abrasive powders, suspensions and pastes for polishing
Pastes, optionally in the form of blocks or sticks

title-part.text: for application to surfaces to minimize adherence of ice, mist or water thereto

reference.text: rendering particulate materials free flowing, in general, e.g. making them hydrophobic B01J2/30

title-part.text: Thawing or antifreeze materials for application to surfaces

reference.text: used in liquids for heat-transfer, heat-exchange or heat-storage or for the production of heat or cold other than by combustion, e.g. radiator liquids, C09K5/00

title-part.text: as substitutes for glycerol in its non-chemical uses, e.g. as a base in toilet creams or ointments
for absorbing liquids to remove pollution, e.g. oil, gasoline, fat
Heat-transfer, heat-exchange or heat-storage materials, e.g. refrigerants
Materials for the production of heat or cold by chemical reactions other than by combustion
Materials undergoing a change of physical state when used
the change of state being from liquid to vapour or vice versa

note.note-paragraph: When classifying in groups C09K5/042, C09K5/044 and C09K5/045 the chemical nature of the material can be further indexed by using indexing codes chosen from C09K2205/00 - C09K2205/48

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising compounds containing carbon and hydrogen only
Boiling liquids as heat transfer materials

title-part.text: the change of state being from liquid to solid or vice versa

CPC-specific-text.text: Materials absorbing or liberating heat during crystallisation; Heat storage materials

title-part.text: Materials not undergoing a change of physical state when used
Molten materials, i.e. materials solid at room temperature, e.g. metals or salts
Solid materials, e.g. powdery or granular
Materials undergoing chemical reactions when used
Antifreeze additives therefor, e.g. for radiator liquids

reference.text: for application to surfaces C09K3/18; inhibiting corrosion by liquids C23F11/00

title-part.text: Compositions for drilling of boreholes or wells
Compositions for treating boreholes or wells, e.g. for completion or for remedial operations

note-paragraph.CPC-specific-note: When classifying in groups C09K8/00-C09K8/40 and C09K8/50-C09K8/94, it is mandatory when appropriate to classify with indexing codes for aspects relating to compositions for drilling or treating boreholes or wells. The indexing codes are chosen from the groups C09K2208/00-C09K2208/34

note.note-paragraph: In groups C09K8/02-C09K8/38, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification is made in the last appropriate place.

title-part.text: Specific additives for general use in well-drilling compositions
containing inorganic compounds only, e.g. mixtures of clay and salt
containing natural organic compounds, e.g. polysaccharides, or derivatives thereof
containing synthetic organic macromolecular compounds or their precursors

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the composition of the clay

title-part.text: characterised by the inorganic compounds other than clay
Natural organic compounds or derivatives thereof, e.g. polysaccharides or lignin derivatives

Derivatives of other natural products, e.g. cellulose, starch, sugars

title-part.text: Spacer compositions, e.g. compositions used to separate well-drilling from cementing masses
Compositions for cementing, e.g. for cementing casings into boreholes
Compositions for plugging, e.g. for killing wells

for squeeze cementing, e.g. for repairing

Additives for reducing or preventing circulation loss
Additives for reducing or preventing gas migration
Compositions for plastering borehole walls, i.e. compositions for temporary consolidation of borehole walls

reference.text: compositions for consolidating loose sand or the like around wells C09K8/56

title-part.text: Compositions based on water or polar solvents

obtained otherwise than by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds

characterised by their form or by the form of their components, e.g. encapsulated material

organic depositions, e.g. paraffins or asphaltenes
inorganic depositions, e.g. sulfates or carbonates
characterised by their form or by the form of their components, e.g. encapsulated material

reference.text: compositions for plastering borehole walls C09K8/50;

title-part.text: Compositions based on water or polar solvents

obtained otherwise than by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds

characterised by the use of bacteria

characterised by the use of specific polymers

title-part.text: characterised by their form or by the form of their components, e.g. foams
combined with additives added for specific purposes
for preventing or reducing fluid loss

obtained otherwise than by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds

characterised by their form or by the form of their components, e.g. encapsulated material

title-part.text: Use of particular materials as binders, particle coatings or suspension media therefor

CPC-specific-text.text: non-luminescent particle coatings or suspension media

title-part.text: containing natural or artificial radioactive elements or unspecified radioactive elements

note-paragraph.CPC-specific-note: When classifying in this group it is desirable to add the indexing codes of groups C09K2211/00 - C09K2211/188 relating to the chemical nature of the luminescent material

title-part.text: having chemically interreactive components, e.g. reactive chemiluminescent compositions

note.note-paragraph: In groups C09K11/08 - C09K11/897, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification of materials is made in the last appropriate place

note-paragraph.CPC-specific-note: In this group, magnesium is considered as an alkaline earth metal

note.note-paragraph: Groups C09K11/0805 - C09K11/0894, with the exception of C09K11/0883 for classifying nitrides, are no longer used for classification of new documents. The backlog of this group is being continuously reclassified to subgroups C09K11/54 - C09K11/897

title-part.text: containing a phenol or quinone moiety
containing a phenol or quinone moiety
containing an amine or imine moiety
containing an amide or imide moiety
containing a phenol or quinone moiety
containing heterocyclic ring with at least one nitrogen atom as ring member
boron, silicon, phosphorus, selenium, tellurium or a metal

CPC-specific-text.text: containing boron, silicon, selenium or tellurium

title-part.text: containing plant or animal materials of unknown composition

reference.text: specially adapted for boreholes or wells C09K8/00; fertilisers C05; consolidating by placing solidifying or pore-filling substances in the soil E02D3/12

note.note-paragraph: This group covers mixtures of soil-conditioning or soil-stabilising materials with fertilisers characterised by their soil-conditioning or soil-stabilising activity.
This group does not cover mixtures of soil-conditioning or soil-stabilising materials with fertilisers characterised by their fertilising activity which are covered by subclass C05G.
For the purpose of classification in this group, the presence of fertilisers in the composition is not taken into account.
In groups C09K17/02 - C09K17/50, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, materials are classified in the last appropriate place.

title-part.text: applied in a physical form other than a solution or a grout, e.g. as granules or gases
applied in a physical form other than a solution or a grout, e.g. as platelets or granules
Condensation polymers of aldehydes or ketones
of natural origin, e.g. cellulosic materials
Compounds having one or more carbon-to-silicon linkages
containing mixtures of inorganic and organic compounds
Inorganic compounds mixed with organic active ingredients, e.g. accelerators
the inorganic compound being a water-soluble silicate
Organic compounds mixed with inorganic active ingredients, e.g. polymerisation catalysts
the organic compound being of natural origin, e.g. cellulose derivatives

note.note-paragraph: In groups C09K19/02 - C09K19/60, with the exception of groups C09K19/0208 - C09K19/0283 ,in the absence of an indication to the contrary, materials are classified in the last appropriate place.
Mixtures containing two or more liquid crystal compounds covered individually by the same one of groups C09K19/04 - C09K19/40 are classified only in that group.

If liquid crystal components of the mixtures classified in groups C09K19/42 - C09K19/50 are of importance as such, they should also be classified according to the compounds in groups C09K19/04 - C09K19/40.

title-part.text: characterised by optical, electrical or physical properties of the components, in general

Super Birefringence Effect (S.B.E.); Electrically Controlled Birefringence (E.C.B.)

title-part.text: characterised by the chemical structure of the liquid crystal components

CPC-specific-text.text: the structure containing one or more specific, optionally substituted ring or ring systems
containing a carbocyclic ring, e.g. dicyano-benzene, chlorofluoro-benzene or cyclohexanone
containing a dendromer structure; Dendritic liquid crystals
characterized by a specific unit that results in a functional effect
the specific unit being a carbocyclic or heterocyclic discotic unit
the specific unit being a luminescent or electroluminescent unit
the specific unit being an optically active chain used as linking group between rings or as end group
the specific unit being a perfluoro chain used as an end group
characterized by a linking chain between rings or ring systems, a bridging chain between extensive mesogenic moieties or an end chain group
the end chain group being a polymerizable end group, e.g. -Sp-P or acrylate
the end chain group being a CH3CH=CHCH2CH2- chain
the linking chain being a -CF2CF2- , -CF2CF2CF2CF2- or -CH2CF2CF2CH2- chain

the linking chain being a -CF2CF2O- chain
the linking chain being a -CF2O- chain
the linking chain being a -CH2CF2O- chain
the linking chain being a -CHFO- chain
characterized by the positioning of substituents on phenylene
the special bonding being an hydrogen bond
the special bonding being a specific pi-conjugated group
containing one non-condensed saturated non-aromatic ring, e.g. cyclohexane ring
containing one non-condensed unsaturated non-aromatic ring, e.g. cyclohexene ring
containing one heterocyclic ring having oxygen as heteroatom
containing one heterocyclic ring having nitrogen as heteroatom
containing one heterocyclic ring having sulfur as heteroatom

title-part.text: containing at least two non-condensed rings
containing at least two benzene rings
at least two benzene rings directly linked, e.g. biphenyls

linked by a chain containing carbon and oxygen atoms as chain links, e.g. esters

Compounds containing at least one asymmetric carbon atom

containing additionally a linking group other than -COO- or -OCO-, e.g. -CH2-CH2-, -CH=CH-, -C=C-; containing at least one additional carbon atom in the chain containing -COO- or -OCO- groups, e.g. -COO-CH*-CH3

containing saturated or unsaturated non-aromatic rings, e.g. cyclohexane rings
